page.title: 19HOMELIFE/FARMING IN MOUNTJOY
page.content: The telephone in BESOUGHAN is a kiosk made out of cast iron. They previously used glass but now they make the windows is plastic and the price of making a 'phone call is 10p. It has windows on 3 sides of the 4. There is a box inside called a 'phone and up behind it there are codes so that you can 'phone anywhere in the country. NEWSPAPER BOX:A newspaper box is where newspapers are left for people to come and collect. It's made of wood and looks like a table. In MOUNTJOY they unfortunately have an as yet unsolved sewage problem,this is partly because the landlord cannot be traced causing a major legal wrangle. Most people own cars because the bus services are not very good.You need a car in winter more than in summer.
